News analysis: The Soviet Union is emerging from the three-week storm raised by the coup to face some questions: Who is leading the country? And where? A1

St. Petersburg fought the Soviet coup in the first hours, with its factory workers and police chief taking leading roles. The city, long called Leningrad, is an example of the extent of reform in the country and how that worked against the coup. A12

A human rights meeting in Moscow would once have been thought of as another forum for East-West hostility. Instead, the international conference there this week is expected to bring new consensus. A13

Soviet military leaders at Harvard are taking a crash course on living with democracy. The classes were planned before the coup, but have taken on new meaning as a more professional military, free from the Communist Party, takes shape. A13 Yugoslavia's fracturing worsened, as election results from the southern republic of Macedonia showed that an overwhelming majority had voted to follow the secessionist republics of Croatia and Slovenia in seeking independence. Clarence Thomas's nomination to the Supreme Court is largely met with indecision by the American public, a New York Times/CBS News poll shows. Overall, the one-third of the respondents who had an opinion gave very different rationales depending on their race. A1

The Senate hearing on Judge Thomas begins today before the Judiciary Committee. The hearing is expected to be a hybrid of the rancorous 1987 sessions of Judge Robert H. Bork and last year's calmer questioning of Judge David H. Souter. A17

Two economic paths in the South are emerging as communities cope -- and fail to cope -- with the loss of manufacturing jobs. In South Carolina, Great Falls and Spartanburg have had widely different success in attracting new businesses. A1

Chicken processors are under attack over their basic fire safety practices after last Tuesday's fatal blaze at a North Carolina plant. The industry has been questioned about worker injury rates, and critics say infrequent inspections have allowed conditions to worsen. A14

A plan to limit abuse by the police uses a list of the 25 officers in Kansas City, Mo., who have many citizen complaints and keeps a closer watch on them. The plan is a sign of the recent increased attention given to police brutality. A1
